segment.source: When your app transitions between unrelated or text-heavy elements, use a fade-out followed by a fade-in.
segment.target: When your app transitions between unrelated or text-heavy elements, use a fade-out followed by a fade-in.

segment.source: This allows the outgoing object to completely disappear before the incoming object is visible.
segment.target: This allows the outgoing object to completely disappear before the incoming object is visible.

segment.source: Fade in the incoming element or elements on top of the outgoing elements if the size of the elements remains constant, and if you want the user to feel that they're looking at the same item.
segment.target: Fade in the incoming element or elements on top of the outgoing elements if the size of the elements remains constant, and if you want the user to feel that they're looking at the same item.

segment.source: Once the fade-in is complete, the outgoing item can be removed.
segment.target: Once the fade-in is complete, the outgoing item can be removed.

segment.source: This is only a viable option when the outgoing item will be completely covered by the incoming item.
segment.target: This is only a viable option when the outgoing item will be completely covered by the incoming item.

segment.source: Avoid fade animations to add or delete items in a list.
segment.target: Avoid fade animations to add or delete items in a list.

segment.source: Instead, use the list animations created for that purpose.
segment.target: Instead, use the list animations created for that purpose.

segment.source: Avoid fade animations to change the entire contents of a page.
segment.target: Avoid fade animations to change the entire contents of a page.

segment.source: Instead, use the page transition animations created for that purpose.
segment.target: Instead, use the page transition animations created for that purpose.
